comments.body: I am not sure that this merits displaying error - as per the comment below this line, there is some special handling for this exception that results in passing the string back as-is for later processing. I appear to have been relying on this behavior, as I am now getting a ton of SyntaxError warnings on Jinja2 templates inlined in my group_vars YAML.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +130,134 @@            return result
    except SyntaxError as e:
        display.warning('SyntaxError in safe_eval() on expr: %s (%s)' % (expr, e))
        # special handling for syntax errors, we just return
        # the expression string back as-is
